website_summaries.verdict: A solid kit for the most part that is easy to use and includes 2 different wristband repair tools.
pros: Kit comes with a number of tools, including anti-magnetic screwdrivers, a watch spring bar tool, and 2 wristband repair tools
cons: Case is on the small side
hard to get all the tools into it
Some felt that the tools broke/bent easily
English translation of the instruction manual is poor

customer_reviews.title: Great and Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for this to arrive today and I am a happy customer. I finally wear my Fossil watch after taking 4 links. With this repair kit, I was able to resized it in less than 5 minutes. Before I start, I watch the YouTube video first to get an idea what each item is for. I suggest that you watch the video first before you use this kit, it's really helpful. You should buy this item, very useful.
customer_reviews.author: amiable amy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! (Update)
customer_reviews.text: Update: It turns out that it's just that they upgrade the tool but forgot to update the product description, good to see that they have updated it! Their customer service is great! I got a refund without having to return the item, had zero problem reach out to them :) Mine doesn't come with the red tool that you see in the product photos, also the blue one clearly is different too.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit to save time and money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to replace the "capacitor" in my Seiko kinetic watch. Mine has a screw on back. I had to fiddle to get a good hold with the wrench but was able to get it off. I can't believe they can make screws as small as they do to fit in these watches but the small screwdriver in this kit removed them. So far that's all I used it for and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: The Tin Man

customer_reviews.title: Should be sold at the Dollar Store....
customer_reviews.text: Not that I was expecting it to be a professional quality set, but this is an extremely cheaply made product. Some parts were missing and some were already broken when received (the tweezers were two pieces of metal glued together....not even welded or otherwise fastened). There were also extra / random metal fragments in the case.....not sure where they came from.... Shipped it back to Amazon the same day I received it and do NOT recommend you waste your time with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this, it is pure junk. the metal spring bar tools are so flimsy they bend when you try to remove pins and are useless. The threads on the watch strap link pin remover are so rough it's almost impossible to get it lined up with the pin. Not to mention the shaft is bent, so when you try to line up the tool with the pin every time you move the remover closer to the pin it changes alinement.
customer_reviews.author: Conejo 44

customer_reviews.title: Don't... just don't
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy backing remover, even worse vice. Would NEVER buy this again. Should be priced at 5 bucks to reflect its quality. Do not buy this if your watch is 45 mm or bigger... backing remover doesn't even stretch that far open. Not the first time I bought janky tools on this site, but lesson learned... Never again... pure dissapointment... again
customer_reviews.author: Shredded Cabbage

customer_reviews.title: pretty good kit for the price
customer_reviews.text: So first things first the case is pretty small for all the tools that come in the kit (The hammer sticks out when closed) but its not a deal breaker, Also the sharp points for some of the tools can tear or pull fibers out in the case. However that being said everything works as described. Was able to size a bracelet for my Seiko samurai which was the main reason for buying. The case back tool also works well on several of my older fossil watches. Very pleased so far
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Most important tool not included
customer_reviews.text: When the features say: "Professional and precision watch repair tool, perfect for common watch trouble, like opening watch backs, watchband adjustment, changing watch batteries, gaskets, adjusting bands, and more" you would assume that the tool for closing the watch back would be included. It's show in the instruction booklet, but not included in the tool set. It's really the whole reason I bought the tool set, as the last time I tried changing the battery myself, I broke the glass tighten the back of the watch. This set is useless for changing batteries. Maybe good for removing links in the watch band.
customer_reviews.author: oneluckywoman

customer_reviews.title: All you need to get started maintaining your own pieces, which is a joy :)
customer_reviews.text: Everything I need to maintain my own watch collection. I like changing my own batteries, adjusting bracelets, doing my own cleanings, fixing minor issues that mostly involve swapping out parts and just general tinkering with time pieces. I'm going to need a few more things to work on the variety of vintage movements I want to work on, but this is everything one would need to get started. Super happy with it, especially how it folds up neatly into one case with a little spare room for some small extra parts.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Look, this is a cheap kit and most everything in it is of poor quality. BUT, it works. It does the job. This is not for a professional watchmaker, or even a mall kiosk battery swapper who's working on watches all the time. It's for the guy (or gal) that wants to be able to adjust their own watchbands and change their own batteries. If that's you, don't hesitate. In my opinion, it's a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but be careful when using it
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to knock something that is inexpensive. But we're here to judge it by quality. Not to compare it to an expensive brand, but for practical use. The Jax works but it is a little hard to use because it's a cheap version. It works, but you have to be patient to line up the notches. You don't want to scratch your watch. Also, it is missing a critical part for some watches. The smallest precision screwdrivers is 1 mm and many nice watches are much smaller. Other than that, it's worked great so far.
customer_reviews.author: P-man

customer_reviews.title: Put money towards a better set
customer_reviews.text: Tried contacting seller no reply. Springbar tool broke after first use, metal soft thus edges won't catch. Pin on other side too thick to use on clasps. Band resizer very wobbly, worried about scratching bracelet when screwing pin down, and base won't srew up high enough to line up with pin. Ended up using plastic Amazon one instead. Yellow pushdown case back opener sturdy and works well except won't fit on tight case backs. Screwdown caseback opener works OK with the expected level of play and fit/finish for this price range. Screwdriver working well, as is case holder.
customer_reviews.author: Jake TM

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter kit for watch lovers.
customer_reviews.text: nice to have. Wish it was better quality but it does the trick. The head of the hammer broke and I was tapping gently while sizing a watch band. Luckily I had a better quality back up . If you buy alot of watches like me, you should have your own tools. Even though this is not the best quality set, it gets the job done and has saved me a bit of money. There is no need to take your watches to the jeweler for sizing. You will be surprised at how easy it is. It's so easy.... even a Cave Man can do it!
customer_reviews.author: C-los

customer_reviews.title: Saves you money
customer_reviews.text: You get all the tools available to the watch repair kiosk at the mall for the price of one visit to the jeweler. I have adjusted multiple watch band. Seiko, Omega, stainless steel bands for Apple watch. Tools may not be the same quality of a fine jeweler but they do the job. Many of the tools are made of plastic and some of the metal tools are flimsy and may not last many uses. All in all though, you will save money with two uses of the kit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Great.. it's funny
customer_reviews.text: Great.. it's funny! I was expecting bad quality but not to the point of things break from the first touch ! Lol , I mean if you need a kit for 1 time use , it's made for that. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not at all professional
customer_reviews.text: If this is a “professional” kit then I’d hate to see what the other kits are like. Broke one link pin tool and bent another on the first use. Gave 2 stars for shipping and for the screwdriver tool and for the fact it all comes in a pouch to keep everything in. Although the hammer makes it so that you can’t zip it so everything falls out anyway. The hammer is a little better then a children’s tool set. And the spring pin tool barely fits most watches.
customer_reviews.author: russ

customer_reviews.title: Great for impatient watch repair and adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I have been hacking at my watches for years with the wrong tools. It’s not that I’m cheap and don’t want to take them too a shop it’s that I’m impatient and want everything done now. This kit has allowed me to remove and add links to a variety of watches. I have watched how online and so far this has provided me with the tools to do what I’ve seen. I especially like the cradle that holds the watch face and keeps the crystal from getting scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Szypula

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: The hammer arrived with the head detached from the handle, it's glued not screwed in. The bracelet pin device arrived in 3 pieces with a broken pin, at least it has a couple of replacements. There is an instruction booklet that is in 5 languages but the English translation is crap. There are other kits for similar money if I had to do it again I'd go with one of them
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be doing what I need at a pretty inexpensive price.
customer_reviews.text: I'll give it 4 stars because it's doing what I need at a pretty inexpensive price. The tools are solid and the tools for removing the watch pins work well. Where I'll list it as "you get what you pay for" is with the adjustable watch back opener. There's play in the adjusters and the pins themselves. It works, but not as tight of an operation as I had hoped. One slight bump and you have to adjust. I'll write back as i use it some more. So far I've taken the back off three watches, but waiting to pick up three different batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Every thing you need minus a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: All the tools you need to open, adjust, and secure your watch while you work on it. Only problem was the screwdriver, the actual handle is nice but the cheap philips and flat head chipped away with only the slightest pressure. Had to buy a separate screwdriver kit from 99c store. Everything else was great and delivered fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jose I. M.

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit to adjust a Stauer watch band. Everything in the kit was good quality. Some people complain about the push pin tools being to easy to break. They are fragile but so are all push pin tools. I’m a big guy who is not known for my gentle touch. I was careful and everything worked fine. Stauer watch bands have pins that can be difficult to get in and out, but only took a few minutes. I would definitely recommend this to someone.
customer_reviews.author: HP in San Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Works but will not last
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I needed it for. I bought the kit for the link remover. I got the links removed successfully but I bent all the pins that came with it doing so. The base of the link remover gets in the way of the pins and is not stable. For a thin watch band, you will end up removing the piece that holds the pin into the device which results in them being bent after about 2 very careful uses.
customer_reviews.author: RahRah

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: This kit arrived well packaged and all of the parts shown were placed well in the zipper case. The watch case opener pins are well machined and threaded so as not to fall out of the opener wrench. Each part is well made and certainly well worth the small purchase price. I say this as a former design engineer involved in high pressure hydraulic valves and pumps.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Zane

customer_reviews.title: The watch back opener didn't work for my invicta 8942
customer_reviews.text: I liked that for the price it gives a lot of tools. However, I bought it specifically to open the watch back to replace battery. But the wrench couldn't move in n out like it's supposed to until I removed 2 screws. Even then, I couldn't use it with my 24 mm. Now, it could also be because I'm amateur that I couldn't use it with the 24 mm. But I wish the tool it self would work properly so that I can say for certain that it's me. Other than that, I have no complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Geat for the Do It Yourselfer!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for fixing up all my watches that need simple things like battery replacement, watch band repairs, stem and crown, replacement, etc. It is nice to have the necessary tools to skillfully take apart my watches without scratching or damaging each timepiece. I now have my watches all repaired allowing me to choose a different timepiece to wear depending on the occaision. Great product to have!
customer_reviews.author: Michael OConnor

customer_reviews.title: great 3 point case back opener
customer_reviews.text: I bought the kit mostly for the adjustable 3 point case back opener. One of the several sets bit it came with fit my watches. The 3 point opener/wrench opened the back case covers with ease, no scratch. Have not tried the 2 point opener. A different 2 point opener I purchased before elsewhere didn't have a firm grip, slipped and scratched the back case over.
customer_reviews.author: Bayview

customer_reviews.title: Decent kit. Exceptional service
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent kit. However it is sized for very small watch backs. I bought it to screw the back of an invicta and at the widest setting it wasn’t close to big enough to work. Likewise, the watch vise wouldn’t expand large enough to hold it. Would be ok for women’s watches or small men’s only. I was very pleasantly surprised when the seller contacted me and said they were sending a larger tool. I haven’t received it yet but I’m impressed with the effort!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M.

customer_reviews.title: The tools are great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this item to repair a fogged water resistant watch after a dip in a pool. The tools are great quality for the price, allowing me not only to work on the watch but then resize the band of the next one I bought after it was determined the broken one was too far damaged from water. My only complaint is that the vise for removing the back can slip from time to time (since there's no way to anchor it to the table). I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: There is no small flathead screwdriver to remove the screw (attached by tape in the photo) that holds the battery in place. The back removal tool and clamp are too small for my larger watch. The tips for the back removal tool aren’t color coded or marked in any way to figure out which three make up a set. Overall, the kit is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Just Dozing

customer_reviews.title: Well made tools
customer_reviews.text: I was particularly happy with the tool that is used to unscrew the back cover of the watch. It was very sturdy and came with several screw-on inserts to accommodate different types of indents or slots for the tool to catch on to unscrew the cover. I had to apply a lot of pressure to remove the back cover and the tool adjusted nicely to my watch size and held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Buldozer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have always taken my watches to a jeweler to size them, but as I collected more watches it became a cost issue and I figure I should learn to do it myself. This kit is perfect has all tools needed to make adjustments and minor repairs. There is no need to buy a kit costing 2-3 times this kit as this kit is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Could not open a screw back watch and tool provided to open other watches was too think for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Walker D. West

customer_reviews.title: Case remover doesn't work on BIG watches.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent product with decent tools, though they don't feel the highest of quality, they do get the job done. But please be aware that the 3 pronged case opener does NOT work on most Fossil watches. Other than that, I have changed the battery and bands in most of the watches I own, along with my wife's and father in laws watches. For the price you can't really go wrong with this, but realize there are some drawbacks. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Tresemer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: It isn't the highest quality product, however the price is good. The case back holder worked well, took off the back but then my worst fear...NO FLATHEAD! Luckily, I had a cellphone repair kit as well, so I could tighten the rotor on my watch. The tool to change straps will probably be the most useful tool.... But I'll probably try to use these to learn how to regulate my watches so it was a great buy. My local watchsmith wanted to charge me $80 to tighten the rotor... So it's already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful kit.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to replace batteries and shorten wristbands on several of mine and my families wristwatches. Comes with several extra sizes of spring pins but haven't need them yet. I've found that usually a 2 prong case opener will work easier than the 3 prong in this kit, but if it's really on tight this one is needed. Has already paid for itself. I also recommend the Zacro watch press for press on backs and a Illuminated Multi-power Head Magnifier, unless you have young eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L.

customer_reviews.title: If your debating... Buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit knowing that it was cheaper than paying someone to size my wife's watch. (Mind you I have tools and have managed to size many watches without a problem. This one simply have me trouble as the pins were rather tight.) I expected a pocket size plastic tool set. This was WAY nicer than I expected. The tools feel solid and reliable. I'm going to open up a few older broken watches and see if I can fix them now. If you need a watch tool kit, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Derek P.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the Eventronic Professional Spring Bar Tool Set with Carrying Case
customer_reviews.text: I'm VERY happy with the "Watch Repair Kit, Eventronic Professional Spring Bar Tool Set Watch Band Link Pin Tool Set with Carrying Case." The quality of the tools is great!!!! My friend does watch repair and can't believe the quality/selection of tools at the price! Right after I got it I used it to replace the battery in my screw-back Seiko watch. I would buy this again and recommend it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: It’s great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could adjust a family members watch band and replace a battery. This kit has all the tools needed for basic watch repairs. It’s not the highest quality watch tools but for the money, you can’t really get better. Definitely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: monica prater

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but the watch pin holder section broke removing from case
customer_reviews.text: overall the kit is good, but as was attempting to remove the watch pin removal device and one of the section broke out from the assembly. not sure if the plastic was old, but for this device did not seem to be of good quality plastic...hopefully this is just on bad device.....everything else seem to be ok
customer_reviews.author: CWO4 D

customer_reviews.title: Just what the watch doctor needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could change the batteries on some old watches I haven't worn for a couple years. Already paid for itself after I found out what kind of batteries they need. A shop would've charged me $20-$30 per watch but now, I'm able to replace all three batteries for $15. The tools came in new condition, some wrapped individually. This kit has everything for adjusting bracelets, replacing bands, screw back time pieces, and many other needs. It's perfect for home use. Couldn't be more pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The threaded inserts that are used for the case back removal tool were defective. I contacted seller and asked that they send new ones as this issue makes the primary tool in the kit useless. They instead offered a partail refund. Sorry a partial refund does nothing as every other tool in the kit can be replicated with tools many of us have on hand. I gave the seller every opportunity to make things right but in the end I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shut him up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Boyfriend cause he hordes watches. He is always belly aching about having to take his watches to have maintenance done or resized. I bought this with the hopes of shutting him up.........it worked. Not a peep out of him in the last 6 months. I’m assuming it does everything he wants. It looked like a good quality kit when I gave it to him. But I’m not a watch fixer guy so what do I know. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Captain B.

customer_reviews.title: Saved Money with this tool and avoided to
customer_reviews.text: For less then $20, I was able to save a ton of money, Foe my Tag Heuer I replaced the battery for $4 the store wanted $55 For my wife's Burberry watch $6 battery the store wanted $250 My Movado $5 battery the store wanted $45 I think it was a great buy. Also the link removal and install tools are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Good value but not amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: This set had everything I needed to open and replace the batteries in some watches that I couldn't get open before. It also comes with a lot of the band springs in various sizes which is nice. However even just opening a few cases there are signs of wear on the case holder and a couple of other tools. It's a fine beginners set at an excellent price, but serious watch enthusiasts will likely want something a bit nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great watch repair tool kit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like this kit very much. I wish the tools were a bit sturdier, but it was relatively cheap, so not going to hold that up against it. I have already used it to fix my wife’s watch and replace a couple of batteries. Just in that it has paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: CosmicBoss

customer_reviews.title: Do not get this; look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Watch back remover is of poor quality, it lacks solidness. The wrench movement is not smooth, is erratic and will not hold its position, it slips after you get it in position. I had to return it it for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Sadao J. Hilario

customer_reviews.title: What does some of this stuff even do?
customer_reviews.text: Most of the tools work, some parts have completely unknown usages, and the too for taking off the back of the watch doesn't work very well. Overall, I'm not fond of it. I can use it to adjust the band of a new watch, saving me $20, but that's about the only use of it for me.
customer_reviews.author: DanG

customer_reviews.title: Surpisingly good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Are these high end german engineered tools? No. Are they completely usable for general watch tasks? Yes. I'm very surprised at how good these are given the crazy low price. Tweezers are too weak to be useful, but everything else works well. Caseback tool has a tiny bit of slop, but for the once-a-year task of opening a watch its completely fine. Unless you service watches constantly, spending any more on a caseback tool that this would be a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Ben A

customer_reviews.title: Great kit with lots of different tools.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit for the $. Best to get if you have multiple watches. Small link punch tool bent, maybe my fault, but was able to remove 4 links from a large Invicta Grand Diver. Would give 5 stars but took bent. The kit had 2 other punch pin tools I used which did not bend.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymooseTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Upon inspection all looked great and was excited to have the tools to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived quickly and timely. Upon inspection all looked great and was excited to have the tools to do some simple repairs. The spring bar remover w/scale broke with first use when removing a watchband. However, the flat-head screwdriver proved to be a suitable alternative to complete the task, All is as expected and would recommend and purchase again. Not sure how the replacement spring bars will hold up yet. Would be nice that the remover didn't break, but still glad to be able to do what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty low quality tools
customer_reviews.text: These are poor quality tools. Several of them have broken after just a few watches worth of work. The wrench to take the back off of watches is so sloppy in it’s build quality that it can’t even grab the back of the watch. It was totally useless. The only thing that has been useful is the small screwdriver, and the link pin remover, that is, until all of the little spikes that you use to remove the pins broke. Now it is useless. Oh yeah, it did come with a tiny Ziploc bag full of different sized band springs, those things that hold the watchband to the watch itself. That’s useful. I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of my plastic watch band tool and it’s cheap bent pin. So for double the price of just that tool alone I got all these well made metal tools for my watch hobby. I am telling friends to bring the simple stuff to me now; bands, links, cleanings & batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Anies

customer_reviews.title: You need this, you just don't know it yet
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things that you don't have and don't know you need. It is well equipped to handle all the repairs you typically take you watch to the jeweler to fix. It will pay for itself with you first battery change or when you need to resize your watch band. If you have several watches you really do need this.
customer_reviews.author: MadKhemist

customer_reviews.title: Construction seems a bit shoddy, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Construction seems a bit shoddy on the wrench bits, but it gets the job done. I've used the kit now on 5 different watches and the variety of tools has been the strongest selling point. I didn't get the exact kit that was pictured, but what I received was comparable.
customer_reviews.author: HunDo

customer_reviews.title: Chaep made
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap made, expected for the price. Was unable to screw off Bulova back plate. Had to buy silicon/rubber ball fo 7 buck s, which did a great job. Will try to returm this kit. Not sure why other reviews are very positive.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Okay for some watches
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason for purchasing this kit was to replace batteries in my watches. The kit contains a tool to remove the backing of some watches, however, this tool is much too thick to work on any of my watches. I had to purchase the tool I needed separately.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great starter repair kit.
customer_reviews.text: There are better quality tools, but not at this price. This one has nearly everything you need, and while some of the tools aren't great, they will all get the job done. I have replaced a few batteries, and resized bracelets both for myself and a couple friends.
customer_reviews.author: John W. ClarkTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Not bad not great but good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and gets the job done. Was able to size my watch bracelet. Not the most sturdy set a few of the parts already broke and I didnt even use them, I only used it once actually. But like I said it does get the job done. Instead of paying $20 per watch to get it sized just pay once for the set and size all of you watches. I have a big collection so it helps. Just wished it was a bit more sturdy. (I have pictures but I dont know how to post them)
customer_reviews.author: Jawad C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: came fast packaged professionally good price has every tool you need for your watch repairs quality product has paid for itself on first 2 repairs 👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Lynwood W.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad price and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what every tool was for at first but it was perfect for doing links on my seiko and getting the back plate off. Got the job done would be nice if it came with a eye piece tho, and getting everything back in the case and closing the case was a bit of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen J.

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this if you have watches
customer_reviews.text: This came with so much stuff and it's all good quality stuff at that. I'm really glad that I got it because I had a citizens blue angle watch that I've had for yrs but never been able to change the battery and now I can. I can't tell you everything because I don't even know how to use it all. I'm super glad I got it though.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Paid for itself in first day.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this to replace watch battery and change watch band link size. Everything worked as advertised. However I did need the help of YouTube. One piece, pin removal for watch band did bend easily. But it could be my fault. It’s very difficult to keep things aligned. So, for now I’ll assume the bending was my fault and not the workmanship of the tools.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit; Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a few watches and felt like to wanted to be able to change and adjust bands myself. This kit makes it soooo easy. I bought a new SS band for one of my Dive watches on Amazon. Was able to install and adjust it in 10 minutes. I easily saved the cost of this kit by purchasing and installing this one band myself. I might get brave and do a battery change too.
customer_reviews.author: Soulcalsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Great basic set of tools
customer_reviews.text: I am a watch piddler - I replace bands and batteries and tinker. This set is perfect for the job. It has all of the tools that I need and they are of decent "handyman" quality. I recommend for this type of purpose - and great value!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Must have repair kit
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of having to pay someone to fix my watches when they need a new battery or if I buy a new one and need the band sized. So I decided to get a kit for it. It's simple enough to do what you need to by yourself. The tools are of good quality and haven't had any issues of them breaking. The only complaint I have is the mallet is too long to fit perfectly in its designated spot in the middle. But you can angle it a little to keep it inside when you zip the case up.
customer_reviews.author: LezGrl79

customer_reviews.title: Watch tool kit
customer_reviews.text: Thought I reviewed this way back when purchased. Great buy. I replaced the batteries in all 20 plus watches I have. Yes my wife says I have a problem. The kit comes with bunch of band pins, more than I will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Stone

customer_reviews.title: The tools work great. I fixed two of my watches that I ...
customer_reviews.text: The tools work great. I fixed two of my watches that I would normally have to take to a jeweler. It has all the tools a casual watch person would need. The only downside is that some of the tools don't stay in place in the case very well. Some of the elastic is too lose an some is too tight. Extremely minor issue though. Super happy I got this.
customer_reviews.author: rnotech

customer_reviews.title: I have to say, Ive spent way too many ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, Ive spent way too many years trying to remove links from watch bands with a hammer and small tools. Sometimes I accidently broke the watch, and most times, I broke the band. This little kit removed links in about 15 seconds, without any damage! Even changed a battery from the back, so my watches, usually around 80 bucks, last so much longer!
customer_reviews.author: mike2803

customer_reviews.title: DIY Watch upgrades
customer_reviews.text: This watch kit has everything needed for basic watch repair and alteration. Already have saved a lot cost wise in replacing my own batteries and changed or sized a few watch bands. Like most people, if a watch doesn't fit perfectly I just lived with it because didn't have the time to go get it sized. Now I did it myself and the results are just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Qmann

customer_reviews.title: Contains much more than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: I had bee looking to adjust a watch band for a while, and since I wasn't wearing it daily when I thought about taking it to a jeweler, I didn't have it with me. So I found this on Amazon and it has everything I needed and much much more. A Very complete kit.
customer_reviews.author: Damien X Heenan

customer_reviews.title: Great selection of tools in the kit
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I would have liked. Have used it on several watch bands and a couple bands had the pins in so tightly that the tool broke the needles repeatedly. Came with a good supply of replacements so all good.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Don’t waste you money. It’s all cheaply made. I should have followed my rule about tools; buy the best. This is not the best. It’s poorly made plastic and low grade metal. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good for home kit, quick change overs.
customer_reviews.text: would have liked better instructions for a few of the tools, but so far the kit is great. Closing the kit up is kind of a pain. the zipper keeps tucking away. Also, the hammer is almost to long for the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Big Steve Stomper

customer_reviews.title: Watch Tool Kit
customer_reviews.text: Several of the tools in this kit came out of the slots. The tools were not that sturdy and the watch case opener handle was bent. The kit appears to have been resealed. I would not purchase this kit again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bowles Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Broke First Use - 2 thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Save your money. See the pictures. Holder was broke is case. Tool end snapped off removing first watch band.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great watch repair kit! 5/5
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at how quick it arrived, less than 24 hours after I ordered it. Anyway, its better than I expected, the pictures dont do it justice. Everything works well and fits nicely into the case. This is a solid watch repair kit and worth every penny! Im already using it to fix the link and battery on my old rufina watch. Id suggest this to anyone looking to by a repair kit. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: heyElvis

customer_reviews.title: This kit has everything!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I used to pay for at the watch store, I am now able to do at home on my own. This kit has everything you will ever need and has saved me so much time, effort, and money. I now size all my family's watches using this too. This product is great
customer_reviews.author: Tyler C.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit but not for Bulova watches
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars even though it doesn't have the right pins for either of my Bulova watches. That's my fault for not knowing what type of pins they took. But the kit itself is very well packed has everything you would need and I felt like a little scientist using it until I realized I can't use the pins.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I’m very impressed with this toolkit. I recently purchased a Seiko SKX watch and used this kit to resize the bracelet. I’ve also used the included prying tool to remove the bezel from the watch. The tools are not professional grade but they have worked really well for these simple adjustments. I’m very glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I am well pleased with this product. It was more than I expected. I only had one issue. The case removal instructions were missing some key points. I had to go to YouTube for better instructions on using the main tool. The adjustable wrench requires using the tool bits which are included in the package. Go ahead and purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: tenn66

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective, handy
customer_reviews.text: Never knew I needed this until I bought it. Have used it multiple times. Having the right tools is essential for jobs well done, and this tool set gets the job done. Nice and small to tuck away, and all the right things you need to adjust bands, etc. Greta little tool kit!
customer_reviews.author: Aural Votary

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use !! Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch repair kit ! I have a samsung galaxy watch !! I buy a lot watch bands so I constantly have links to take out! This makes it way easier than the ones that come with the bands. Well worth the price !! I've used it once if anything changes I'll be sure and let yall know !
customer_reviews.author: stephanie tippie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, good selection of tools.
customer_reviews.text: Most tools in package work well, and you have a very wide selection. The case back wrench works but doesn’t seem to hold or lock into the size you need. Good buy overall definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This tool kit will cover all of your basic watch needs, and then some. I've use it to take links out of my watch, adjust the timing on an automatic watch, adjust the hinge screw on various eye-wear, remove press pins. It's a very handy little tool kit, that has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!!!
customer_reviews.text: This kit comes with all the tools needed to fix just about any watch or metal watch band. Got three GShock watches and one Fossil watch looking and working like new with this kit. Great kit and a must have for the DIY watch job.
customer_reviews.author: John Huff

customer_reviews.title: Works well especially for the price. Had one watch ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well especially for the price. Had one watch with 4 extremely tiny screws. I didn't think it was going to work at first but I was able to take the back off and put it back on with this kit. I also removed links in a couple of watches.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Wrench is junk
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason I bought this set was for the case wrench, but it’s total junk and wobbly. No worky. The other tools are ok, but that doesn’t make up for the junk wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality tools
customer_reviews.text: Threaded tools did not work properly or smoothly. Metal used was soft and or brittle. Looked good, but inferior quality. Buy Swiss if yo can afford. Much better long term investment
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Frank Vorell

customer_reviews.title: Same thing most small jewelers use to size your watch.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit and changed the watch size on my Omega and Tag Heuer in 20 minutes. I should have gotten this a while ago. Quality stuff. Add a pair of needle nose pliers to the case and you’ll have everything you need. Great for resizing your own watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Used it successfully to shorten links on Seiko 5
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Feels quality. Used it to remove watchband from one watch. Used it another time to shorten links on a Seiko 5 watch. Did the job just fine with the help of a "how-to+ YouTube video. Would recommend purchasing especially if your local jeweler will charge a small fee to adjust watchband link size.
customer_reviews.author: E Laureano

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for price point
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit, comes with everything you need to perform basic service on your cherished watch collection. No more petty fees or trips to the jewler for link removal or battery changes. 97% of the time that’s all your good watch will ever need. So far I have changed two batteries and adjusted two bands without a hitch!
customer_reviews.author: Victorious

customer_reviews.title: Is alright
customer_reviews.text: If you're a newbie then their semi manual (???) with pictures won't help you jack!
customer_reviews.author: Ramiro Castro

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent quality kit
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent quality kit, I managed to replace batteries in 4 different type of watches. To beginners like me, make sure to select the correct pins to unscrew the back plate.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Pedruzzi

customer_reviews.title: but I don't recommend trying to use this on an expensive watch
customer_reviews.text: It does honestly do what is intended of it on cheap quartz watches, but I don't recommend trying to use this on an expensive watch. It's a tool set that honestly looks and feels quite cheap. Though for the price? What can you expect.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Worked as described
customer_reviews.text: The items in the kit worked for me. Was able to take the back off my wristwatch quite easily and make adjustments, whereas without the tools I probably would have screwed it up. So I am satisfied with this kit, which will have more uses in the future for other watches in my collection. Was a good buy IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Price

customer_reviews.title: link remover
customer_reviews.text: OMG I wish I had bought this years ago I would’ve saved me and my family and friends allot of money they charge 10 dollars to take links out i can easily do it with this myself thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: CARMEN CORTES

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: Have a Luminox watch with a dead battery. Trouble finding anyone willing to deal with the screw-on back. This tool set was less than mailing the watch to someone to look at it. In 2 minutes I had the battery replaced and the watch working. Good quality and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mounce

customer_reviews.title: Good for small fixes on your watch
customer_reviews.text: The set is not high quality but also not bad. Considering what it cost it fulfills the value for money aspect. Already used to change and adjust straps and changing batteries. Careful if you use the case opener as due to the style it easily slip and can leave scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: Nice tools.
customer_reviews.text: Giving four stars because case start falling apart. See Picture. Not returning because I started using and there are some dents present on one of the tools. I noticed the tear on the case after I used it. Very nice tools. very usefull
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Purisch

customer_reviews.title: Beginner set for those who are curious about watch making
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit, but the tools are poorly made with low quality materials so they don't last long. Good way to get into watch modding though before spending money on high quality tools.
customer_reviews.author: Kuei Chao

product_meta.title: Watch Repair Kit, Eventronic Professional Spring Bar Tool Set Watch Band Link Pin Tool Set with Carrying Case
feature_bullets: High quality and professional watch repair tool kit, solutions for most watch repair requirements
Metal watch band link remover, more professional watch spring bar tool ,anti-magnetic screwdrivers, and other top tools, more choice for fun to repair your watch
Two watchband repair tools, you can choose your favorite tool to repair, enjoy the fun of two different repair band methods
Professional and precision watch repair tool, perfect for common watch trouble, like opening watch backs, watchband adjustment, changing watch batteries, gaskets, adjusting bands, and more
All the tool kit set in the black nylon bag, easy to carry and storage,before using the product, please read the manual first

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,510 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
